intro: Boehmeria densiflora var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its fibrous stems have been historically used for making textiles and paper.
